message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this incredible product. It's a one-of-a-kind opportunity to own something truly unique. I'm willing to sell it to you for $2000000. I think it's a fair price considering its value and rarity. What do you think?

I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, but I'm not sure it's worth $2000000 to me. I was thinking more along the lines of $600000. I'm willing to consider a price that's closer to my budget. Can we discuss further?

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that $2000000 is a stretch for you, but I'm not willing to go as low as $600000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $1400000. This is the lowest I can go, and I think it's still a great deal for both of us. What do you think?

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice, but $1400000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to go a bit higher than my previous offer, but I think $900000 is the maximum I can stretch to. Can you consider that?

I understand that $900000 is a bit of a stretch for me, but I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll offer it to you for $1200000. This is the highest I'm willing to go, and I think it's still a great deal for both of us. What do you think?

I appreciate your flexibility, Alice, but I'm still a bit short of my target. I'm willing to meet you in the middle again, so I'll offer $1100000. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement.

I understand that $1100000 is a good offer, but I'm still not willing to go that low. I've already compromised a lot, and I think I deserve a bit more. I'll offer it to you for $1300000. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement. If not, I'll have to consider other options.
